options.text: 250g of Methylophilus methylotrophus produce 25×103 kg of protein in a day
The shift from meat to grain diets creates more demand for cereals.

<math><mn>250</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> cow produces <math><mn>200</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi></math> of protein per day.
Spirulina when growing on sewage also reduces environmental pollution besides producing large quantities of protein.

solution.text:
The shift from grain to meat diets creates more demand for cereals as these are used to produce the feed for the animals that are grown for meat production. This results in increased demand for cereals.

SCP-single cell proteins are the proteins obtained from the culture of single-celled organisms on an industrial scale as these require minimal nutrients like molasses, sewage, wastewater. These cells can serve as rich sources of food nutrients like proteins. For example, 250g of Methylophilus methylotrophus produce 25 x103 kg of protein in a day. These microbes also help in reducing environmental pollution.
